wikipedia_page.main: Charles Henry Lumley VC (1824 – 17 October 1858) was a Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: * Charles Lumley (1824–1858), recipient of the Victoria Cross

link_mentions.page: List of Scottish Victoria Cross recipients

response: Charles Lumley (1824–1858), awarded the Victoria Cross during the Crimean War, was buried in the cathedral churchyard.

link_mentions.page: 97th (The Earl of Ulster's) Regiment of Foot
The Queen's Own Royal West Kent Regiment Museum
response: The Queen's Own Royal West Kent Regiment Museum is the regimental museum of the Queen's Own Royal West Kent Regiment.  It is an independent museum located inside the Maidstone Museum & Art Gallery, located in St Faith's Street in Maidstone, England.  The museum displays four of the six Victoria Crosses won by members of the regiment (those of John Pennington Harman, John Coleman, Charles Lumley, and Thomas James Harris).
